column19: Computing and telecommunications: business as usual — Operations
column21: This appropriation is intended to cover expenditure on the purchase
column23: servicing and maintenance of hardware and software and on outside assistance from service bureaux and IT consultants for business-as-usual operations to ensure that the European Parliament’s computing and telecommunications systems function properly. That expenditure relates mainly to systems at the computer and telecommunications centre
column24: computing at departmental level and network management operations.
column25: The amount of assigned revenue in accordance with Article 21(3) of the Financial Regulation is estimated at EUR 155 000.

column21: This appropriation is intended to cover expenditure on the purchase
column23: servicing and maintenance of hardware and software and on outside assistance from service bureaux and IT consultants for business-as-usual operations to manage and maintain the European Parliament's computing and telecommunications system infrastructure. That expenditure relates mainly to network
column26: individual equipment and voting system infrastructure.
column27: The amount of assigned revenue in accordance with Article 21(3) of the Financial Regulation is estimated at EUR 164 000.

column24: The amount of assigned revenue in accordance with Article 21(3) of the Financial Regulation is estimated at EUR 77 000.

column24: as well as administrative and legislative applications.
